result.execSummary:
The defendant Brandon Terry Harris was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm; and that his voting rights are suspended and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeded.   Statements made as to sentencing.   

Court ordered defendant to serve 60 days in the House of Correction, with 60 days credit for time served.  TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

Court ordered applicable costs, fees and surcharges to be paid by 10/07/2016.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank - surcharge IMPOSED.
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.

Filed:
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit

Defendant Brandon Terry Harris in court with attorney Calvin R. Malone.  Defendant Brandon Terry Harris in custody.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for motion hearing, however parties would like to proceed with a plea hearing instead.    Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Defendant Brandon Terry Harris in court with attorney Calvin R. Malone.  Defendant Brandon Terry Harris in custody.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for motion hearing.  Court ordered witnessed sequestered.  Sworn for the state: Glendale Police Sargent Rhett Fugman and Officer Rollan Parish.  Arguments heard.  For reasons stated on the record, the Court DENIED the defense motion to suppress.  Defense requests motion hearing date on another matter.  Defense motion due 09/14/2015, state reply due 09/28/2015.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Motion hearing scheduled for October 7, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Order to Produce for Motion Hearing on August 11, 2015 @ 8:30 am received and filed

Defendant Brandon Terry Harris in court with Attorney Calvin R. Malone.  Defendant Brandon Terry Harris in custody.  
Nicholas Cerwin for Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before the Court for Motion hearing.  The state missing essential witness.  State motion to adjourn heard; defense objects.  Defense filed new case law on today.  The state needs time to review said filing.  The Court grants adjournment of motion hearing.  All parties are notified that effective 8-03-15 this case will be assigned to Branch 22, Judge Witkowiak, in room 608 of the Courthouse.  Filed, Supreme Court of the United States case.  Motion hearing scheduled for August 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Brandon Terry Harris in court with attorney Calvin R. Malone.  Defendant Brandon Terry Harris in custody.  Marissa Luz Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Defense filed their motion past the filing due date and State needs timne to respond. Court grants joint request for an adjournment. Case rescheduled for MOTION HEARING on 6/25/2015 at 10:00 am in Branch 15.
Defendant's Motion to Suppress Evidence Based on an Unlawful and Warrantless Search, received and filed. sab
Court is not in session on 4/24. Case rescheduled for MOTION HEARING on 5/22/2015 at 10:00 am in Branch 15. sab
Original Transcript PRELIMINARY HEARING (16 pages) commencing 03/03/2015 received and filed.

Attorney Calvin R. Malone in court, defendant Brandon Terry Harris not in court, in custody. David Behm for Marissa Luz Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Case calendared for MOTION HEARING on 4/24/2015 at 1:30 pm in Branch 15. Any motions are to be filed by 3/24/2015 and any response from the State is to be filed by 4/21/2015.

Defendant Brandon Terry Harris in court with attorney Calvin R. Malone.  Defendant Brandon Terry Harris in custody.  Ron Dague for Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk:  HMP
  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Court took judicial notice of certified documents regarding case #12CF4954 that are attached to the complaint. Sworn for the state: City of Glendale Police Officer, Rhett Fugman.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 15.

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Fiorenza.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Watts, Br. 15.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Brandon Terry Harris in court with attorney Calvin R. Malone.  Defendant Brandon Terry Harris in custody.  George David Kidd appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
ORIGINAL COMPLAINT NOT IN COURT FILE.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
